messages: 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:10): maybe the solution to <switch> is simply to have a "hidden" attribute
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:10): and some API to toggle one element off and another one on
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:11): or just require people to do  loginform.hidden = true; game.hidden = false;
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:11): certainly would be simple
5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67 (11:13): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: A global hidden attribute?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:13): yeah
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:13): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: would it in terms of CSS toggle display: none; instead of visibility: hidden;?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:13): i'm just trying to work out the semantic part, i haven't really thought about the rendering
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:14): i guess from a rendering perspective you'd have [hidden] { display: none; }
5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67 (11:14): <foo hidden="false">
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:14): I wonder if the name confuses authors who know about CSS "hidden"
5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67 (11:15): Prototype JS uses hidden() as well
5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67 (11:15): foo.hidden() => boolean
c6abb49e663030403f65db047e2cb714 (11:15): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: might be easier to understand .visible instead of .hidden, since it's positive
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:16): we need something that defaults to visible
5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67 (11:16): With .visible I'd think about visibility: hidden|visible
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:16): so the attribute, if it's an attribute, has to hide it
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:16): invisible
5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67 (11:16): I still don't get why that should be in HTML..
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:16): invisible could work, though i'd like a name that more obviously means the content is irrelevant... maybe irrelevant=""
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:17): 5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67: imagine you're doing a web based game
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:17): 5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67: and you have a login page, then a game page, then a game over page with the high score
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:17): 5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67: and these are all just <section>s in a single HTML page
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:17): 5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67: the game page is semantically irrelevant until the login page has been used to log in
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:18): 5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67: and then the login page is semantically irrelevant once the game has started
5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67 (11:18): Yeah, I get that part
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:18): 5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67: even without CSS, you'd still want those parts of the page to not be shown
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:18): 5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67: that is, their presence is not stylistic
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:18): 5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67: it's semantic
5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67 (11:19): For backwards compatibility it should be three separate pages anyway,
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:19): well for now, sure, but eventually once html5 has a large install base, that won't be a problem
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:20): and in the meantime you can use it if you put something in your stylesheet or script
5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67 (11:20): So you could have a website in one big file, and swap hidden sections while you navigate through it
5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67 (11:21): Or is it only for a page where you have to 'start' at one section
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:22): 5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67: it's for things where it would make no sense to show everything at once
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:23): 5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67: where the other thing would actually be completely irrelevant, unusable, and nonsensical if shown
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:23): 5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67: if it would make sense to have the two things opened in two tabs or two windows at once, then this feature wouldn't apply
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:24): e.g. it wouldn't be appropriate to use this for tabs, or to split a big page into multiple panels, etc
5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67 (11:24): So what happens when you make multiple sections visible at once?
5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67 (11:25): If it's really a switch thing, only one can be 'visible', right?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:25): how do you mean?
5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67 (11:25): Well, say you have 3 sections, for that game
5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67 (11:25): Only one is relevant
5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67 (11:26): Now you switch to a different section
5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67 (11:26): foo1.hidden = true; foo2.hidden = false
5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67 (11:26): What if you don't hide foo1
5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67 (11:26): Then it's no switch
fe4724de6658ca02a3de71341985e297 (11:27): Is there an accessibility bod contributing to this thread?
5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67 (11:27): So those two statements should be just one, relevantRightNow = foo2

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:27): 5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67: well, you could imagine cases where something might become relevant but otherwise might not be, independent of other things, e.g. a notification "window"
5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67 (11:27): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: If you could make all sections visible at once, I don't get why they couldn't be separate pages
fe4724de6658ca02a3de71341985e297 (11:28): http://ua-games.gr/game-over
fe4724de6658ca02a3de71341985e297 (11:28): We have just released "Game Over!", the world's first universally
fe4724de6658ca02a3de71341985e297 (11:28): inaccessible game!
fe4724de6658ca02a3de71341985e297 (11:28): Game Over! aims to provide game developers with a first-hand
fe4724de6658ca02a3de71341985e297 (11:29): (frustrating) experience of how it feels interacting with a game that
fe4724de6658ca02a3de71341985e297 (11:29): is not accessible due to the fact that important accessibility design
fe4724de6658ca02a3de71341985e297 (11:29): rules were not considered or applied.

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:29): 5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67: imagine your page is a status dashboard for some network service, and there are three servers, and each one can sent a status message at any time
fe4724de6658ca02a3de71341985e297 (11:29): have to run..later
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:29): 5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67: the status window for a server is irrelevant/nonsensical/unusable unless the server is sending a message
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:30): 5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67: but all three servers might send a message at once, in which case all three windows are relevant/usable
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:30): 5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67: but the messages aren't "pages" as far as the user is concerned
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:30): (though i guess they might well be "pages" in the REST sense)
5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67 (11:42): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: Sorry, I was thinking about a <switch><case>..</case><case>..</case></switch> kinda thing :)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:42): yeah that was my original thought too
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:42): i think an attribute is more flexible
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:43): but the problem is people will use it for tabs, and for multi-page pages that really should just be a big page with some styles to show/hide sections
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:43): not sure how to design the feature so it's not misused
5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67 (11:44): Tabs you don't want to see aren't relevant, right? :)
5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67 (11:54): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: Would children of irrelevant elements show up in the DOM?

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:55): tabs are just a way of re-rendering a group of <fieldset>s so that only one of them is rendered -- the other tabs are just as relevant, they're just not shown
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:55): yes, the DOM would be unaffected
